CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 20, 1953, pg. 27 reads: "He Won A Bowling Trophy, Presented Another - William (Andy) Anderson, captain of the Courier Bowling team at the Hillvue Alleys, won the championship crown for himself in Men's Singles Classic League and the Courier team, which he heads, won the fifth place team trophy, donated by the Steel City League...on the right, he is shown holding his own trophy. There were ten teams in the league.  Other members of the Courier team not shown were Harry Gladden, William Smith, Walter Smith and William Price. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William "Andy" Anderson holding championship bowling trophy in the Men's Singles Classic League, posed in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper office
